Reviews.Title: “Basic but friendly”
Reviews.Author: SallyEH
Reviews.Content: I always say that so little time is spent in the hotel on a city break that basic is best. This was a very small room and very hot.Would not like to be there in Summer. The reception staff were friendly and helpful however and it was OK. The bathroon had been refurbished to a basic standard but the walls in the bedroom needed a coat of paint. However everything was clean. I`d say Travel Lodge standard minus one . We paid for this with Airmiles but I don`t remember it being cheap. Quite well situated, especially as the Barcelona Marathon passed the end of the block. Rather than pay 8euros for breakfast there is a lovely cafe 2 doors down where we got coffee and croissant for 2euros.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona-Sagrada Familia-feel the heart.”
Reviews.Author: larsthetmark0606
Reviews.Content: Arriving late after midnight - no problemo. Helping with informations about anything - no problemo. Sending our forgotten handy to Denmark, for free - no problemo. Mailing all our postcards from Gaudis beautiful city - no problemo. We can only recommend this very good hotel to anyone who wants to stay out of the city center, but still wants to live in the heart of Barcelona. Very good and very clean room - cleaned every day. Superb breakfast - fruit and what ever you can imagine. Nice and helpful staff. The Sagrada Familia is only 3 minuts walk away and so is the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, boiling hot, and £200+ per night”
Reviews.Author: Jo T
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to needing to be in Barcelona on business at the same time as the recent Mobile phone expo which brought in 50,000 visitors. This hotel certainly made hay whilst the sun shone !! £220 for a miniscule room with no external windows, it was so hot that I could barely breathe and the bed was so uncomfortable that a trip to the Chiro's was required !! On the plus side it is in a good location, and if you were fortunate to be in a room that did have a little more space than mine , then I would be tempted to part with say £90 per night but if the costs is over this, then I'm sure you'll be able to find better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Jobezurich2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early March and it was a really nice experience. When we arrived we were advised that we had reserved a room with a private terrace (don't remember doing that). Room was very spacious, clean, bright and a very comfortable double bed. Our terrace was very nice, and no wind so was a sun trap - nice! We paid for breakfast when booking which was very tasty. Nice continental spread. Location was perfect as only 2 mins walk to the Sagrada Familia and the metro. Would definitely stay here again. Only negative would be lack of iron and ironing board in room although travel size ones were available from reception but had to be returned the same day. Would certainly recommend overall

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: mountkeen
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel, the receptionist was very welcoming and helpful. Nice clean room at the back of the hotel meant that we avoided the noise of the traffic on the street-side. Bed was a bit on the hard side though and advertised satellite TV was not available. Free wi-fi was very useful though. A five minute walk from the Sagrada Familia church and metro station and a ten minute walk to the St Pau hospital means there are a few things to see in the immediate area as well as being handily placed for travel into the centre of the city. Lots of cafes and restaurants in the surrounding streets as well as small supermarkets.

Reviews.Title: “Short break at Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: oldbill186302
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with helpful staff and very convenient for the Sagrada Famila itself. It is a long way from the Old Town and other sights, but the Metro was near and buses were plentiful. Taxis were also readily available and reasonably priced. Room overlooked a central shaft, so was quiet and perfectly adequate, everything worked, including safe. No fridge or minibar. Breakfast was good with choice of fruit, cereals, yoghurt, breads, pastries, meats and cheese as well as cooked eggs etc. A small roof terrace was a bonus at sunset and would be better in summer, but the hotel had no bar and as I was with a large group, we had nowhere on site to meet up and socialize. However, there were quite a few small bars and restaurants close by. Although out of town a good location, two blocks from Gaudi's masterpiece.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: oni_lovely
Reviews.Content: Since my main concern to come to Barcelona was to visit La Sagrada Familia, so I chose hotel that was near La Sagrada Familia. I saw this hotel from internet and saw some reviews at trip advisor. Before I made the payment through book online, I asked the staff at Sagrada Familia for several questions, and they respond was fast, since I lived at Singapore, there was a time difference with Barcelona, but to my surprise their respond was quite fast. The fastest was around 30 minutes reply. And they always polite to answer my endless questions. They also had a company partner to made shuttle bus upon arrival & I took the shuttle bus as well. Before I came there the management sent me email to welcome me. And while I was there, the staff were polite. I had problem with the direction that the female staff gave me (couldn't remember her name), I think she gave me wrong direction but it was OK since I found the place by myself. The room was a bit small and dark, but to my surprise the bath room was spacious. I love the shower ! At my first night, I still could hear sound from outside my room. And I didn't feel comfortable with the door. Because usually when we closed & lock our door from inside, usually the door will locked, but I still could open my door directly. It was like the locked was spoiled. According to the staff, nobody could open the door from outside unless it was staff hotel & cleaner (who had the other card to access my room). Since I'm traveling alone, I don't feel really comfortable with the door. But for 55 euro this hotel was awesome ! They also cleaned the room everyday. And also near to La Sagrada Familia, only 7 minutes walking distance. The rooftop according to the staff during winter time only open until 6 pm. Since most of my stay, I walked around Barcelona, so I only had a chance to see the rooftop on my last day. And it was nice. And after I came back to Singapore, I still received email from the hotel to thanked me for my stay. I will definitely choose this hotel if I come back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well location is good!”
Reviews.Author: Grannyhubbard
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. Location great. Near to Sagrada Familia. Near to bars and restaurants, not many, but enough, near to Turiste bus stop. Room? We booked a double, but got a twin, room 302, avoid this room!!!! Looks onto road, noisy! Small, my bathroom is bigger! Half a wardrobe, no bedside drawers, just a shelf each side of beds. Nowhere near enough storage space. No toiletries are provided, well a tiny weeny bar of soap is. Lucky we took our own. No kettle, cups, tea or coffee provided, lucky we took our own. On arrival, my pillow was heavily soiled, no protector just a filthy pillow and a clean pillow case. I bumped into manager on way to complain, so showed him, much to distress of the cleaner, who was with him, so was soon given a new clean pillow. Beds? Mattress covered, BUT with waterproof covers, so think you're in a hospital bed! Nowhere to have a drink be it Tea, Coffee or Alcohol. So stuffed if forget kettle! We were adament that we'd never go back to this hotel, BUT, it is handy, it was clean, except pillow, the staff are pleasant, so, all in all, we will go back, but, would not stay in same room, would ask to be moved. Now that we know what to expect. Beware of Taxi fares it cost nearly 90 euros from airport and back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: piglet_68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a room with a terrace (so we could smoke) The room itself was a little on the small side and could do with a little more storage space (drawers) but as we only really used the room for sleeping this wasn't a problem. The staff were courteous and very helpful, the room was kept immaculately clean every day. We didn't try breakfast so can't comment on that. The location is brilliant - being so close to Sagrada Familia meant we could use the metro to go anywhere and never really get lost!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: StephanieNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights. The location was great- just two blocks from Sagrada Familia so very central and handy for the metro. The staff were usually helpful but my last two days there were very trying. The wifi only worked the first day then nothing - was told they were changing from one service to another so essentially I got one day or wifi and not three (had work to do so was an issue). The rooms were unbearably warm - when I asked what I could do I was told basically nothing. The window I had opened to a courtyard so no breeze and the unit in the room was only for heat. Was frustrating. Sort of recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Creetyuk
Reviews.Content: Loved the fact this small hotel is in a residential neighborhood but still very convenient to everything you need (right down to the bodega across the street). The WiFi in room did not work so I was forced to find a local internet location. Fortunately it was very cheap (50 cents for 1/2 hour). The breakfast was amazing (extra cost). Some interesting restaurants along the way and some GREAT bakeries. This was sort of bare bones but quite adequate for my needs. I usually stay in hostels. Stayed for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “a good base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: bexley_travellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for a few days, dont think I would of wanted to have stayed much longer the bedding was clean and so was the room the room could of done with a paint and the sink in the batrroom had loads OF cracks wasnt sure if it was the Gaudi effect or just well worn The towels are very small hard and thin that was my only real grip we stayed at the front of the hotel quite at the weekend but weekdays so noisey kept us awake from around 6am our friends had a back room much better and quiter we had a mini bar and safe the safe was free of charge We didnt have breakfast as not included was offered if booked in advance 8 euros but when we asked the next guy on the desk he said ni 11 euros to be honest it wouldnt have been worth 11 euros for a few croissants toast etc as thye scrambled egg sausage beans all looked very dried up the staff were friendly not that I saw any apart from the men on the desk it was very quite we were allowed to keep out cases in a room when we arrived as room not ready and same on day of leaving as flight late you can keep in your room till 12 which was good the Gaudis cathedral was a few streets away and the metro was so simple to use and I would reccomend the open top bus 30 euros each for 2 days or 23 euros 1 day well ,worth it the metro cost a single trip of around 1.50 be carefull check prices we went to a cafe near where we syayred and the fdrink were mega expensive

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: furryneck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, and found the standard of the property excellent, modern, clean, and well located for sights, especially the Sagrada Familia Cathedral (2 blocks away). Several minmarkets and 3 supermarkets nearby. Rooms were modern and clean, and in European style not huge, but quite adequate. Beds were perhaps a little too firm for my liking but bearable. Staff friendly and helpful, price really excellent, and the breakfast, I thought , very good. I would absolutely recommend the place for it's placement and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for city break”
Reviews.Author: Gybbsy
Reviews.Content: Good location for the Metro only 5 min walk. Quite a few bars locally for cheap drinks. Staff friendly and helpful. Beds a bit hard though!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Neostream
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this hotel for 7 nights, I didn't expect much from it but it was a very nice, very very clean and modern hotel and has a great location. It's easy to get around and walking distance to the Sagrada Familia and easy access to the subway and tourist bus station. I would thoroughly recommend getting a 2 day tourist bus pass that takes you to all the tourist attractions within and slightly outside the main city area. The staff at the hotel were helpful but not friendly, especially at the check in desk. The room was nice and comfortable, clean, modern with a great comfy bed, and equipped with TV and a mini-bar reasonably priced. Shower room was large and equipped with basic toiletries and our towels were changed every day even if we didn't request it! A computer is available in the lobby for checking email but there is also wifi in the rooms. Breakfast buffet in the morning was fine and included fruit, cereal, cheese, ham, cakes. There were a couple of bars and places to eat around the hotel though very limited there were a few fast food places and a supermarket. If you are staying in the city for the day after checking out of the hotel, just ask the reception staff to hold your bags and they will lock them away in a cupboard for you to collect later. Overall the hotel was an excellent base to explore the city from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vvadell
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sagrada Familia is a great 3 star hotel (a little pricey) in a goodlocation! My boyfriend and I stayed here for about a week. It was walking distance to la sagrada familia and to the metro stop. We did not eat at the hotel-- since there is such good food in Barcelona-- we thought why eat here? The room and bathroom was pretty spacious and super clean. No complaints about the staff-- they were super friendly and accommodating. The only thing that I could maybe complain about is the fact that we asked for one queen or king bed and we were placed in a bedroom with two full beds placed together. So it was kind of awkward sleeping... other than that everything else was fine. They had a computer area/reading and they also had this cool deck at the top of the hotel were you could have a great view of the city. It wasn't far from the national airport... about 15 euros in taxi. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a tight budget and wants to get the best out of their Barcelona experience! I know we did :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average at best”
Reviews.Author: cs_frimley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 6 month old son, arrived at Sagrada Familia during September 2011. Having had a nightmare journey (not because of the hotel, of course) we arrived at 11pm. At this point the receptionist informed us that there was a problem with our room booking and that we'd have to move five minutes in a cab to another hotel. As our son was screaming, I couldn't quite believe their ineptness as despite having a booking receipt in my hand, there was no booking! Eventually we swapped with friends. The room was a decent size, as was the bathroom. A/C worked well (despite leaking extensively during the first night causing a slippery surface on the laminate flooring). Additionally friends who stayed in the room next to us had to call up the receptionist at 2am due to an unknown 'buzzing' noise in their room, which went undiagnosed and they had to move rooms the next day! Beds were uncomfortable and although this was a double bedroom, the beds were two singles with single sheets, covers etc. The one provided pillow was too thin to be of any use. Breakfast was €11 per person and acceptable. Not extensive but the staff were very helpful, sterilising baby bottles and providing hot water. Breakfast was from 8am which was quite late in my opinion but did last until 10.30. There are plenty of cafe's/supermarkets nearby so there is plenty of choice when needing an alternative to breakfast or dinner. Note: It took 35 mins to get to the airport by Taxi on a Monday morning rush hour and cost €33. The hotel is within easy reach of the Sagrada Familia and the metro The road outside is one of the more quiet roads in the area As mentioned in other reviews, the reception staff are either very helpful or useless. Those at night seem to be inept, or completely uninterested in your needs/concerns The restaurant staff/chamber maids are very attentive

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel for a tight budget in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Trippety
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel from 4 Sep to 8 Sep. We booked it as a package via Lastminute,com and it was by far a cheaper package than the others we looked at. We paid £170 each for the hotel and flights and airport parking. We hopped in a taxi at the airport to the hotel and it cost 28 euros and took about 15/20 minutes. The hotel is 2 blocks away from La Sagrada Familia, where this is a metro (underground subway). I was worried that the hotel may be a little far out from the tourist attractions, but it was fine. We walked to nearly all the places we visited (La Rambla, Parc Guell, Port Vell, La Riberia etc). It was a long walk - may be 40 minutes to La Rambla, but it felt very safe and with our map it was very straight forward. The only time we used the metro was to get to Montjuic and to get back to the airport. Each single journey only costs 1.70 euros, no matter how many changes you make. (The airport run costs 3 euros extra as you also have to get the train aka Renfe). The hotel itself, is very clean and quiet. We didn't see many other guests. The maid cleaned our room every single day, except one (but I think that was because we laid in too long!). The only noise we did hear was furniture moving/doors banging in the morning, but it wasn't too much of a nuisance, The receptionists aren't overly friendly/chatty, but that may be a language thing. Any time we asked anything they were helpful and kindly booked us a taxi one evening. We also emailed them before our stay to ask about having one of the rooms with the fridge and they replied straight away and sorted it, which was really good. There wasn't a tea/coffee making facilities in the room, The rooms are a lot more spacious than I thought they'd be. We had room 309 which had a double bed (not the most comfortable, but it was okay), a mini fridge which was really handy. We took out the overpriced drinks in there, and filled it with our stuff from the supermarket (go to Carrefour Express - it's like a Tesco Express - and is just before the Sagrada Familia). The drinks in the fridge were priced two euros each, but the same one in the supermarket costs 0.5euros! The bathroom was probably the best part - the shower was super hot and really powerful. It also had a bath with bath lights. Spacious in there. Two big mirrors in the room. It also had a hairdrier and shampoo/showergel which was restocked everyday. The breakfast would have costs 7 euros extra each day for a basic continental, so we didn't bother. We bought pastries/fruit from the many bakeries for 2 euros! There is also a little bakery/shop a few doors along that sells gorgeous baklava - well worth a visit. The free wifi didn't seem to work during any part of our visit. There was computers in the lobby that charged 1 euro for 5 mins or something like that. There is a main street two blocks down that has lots of cafes/restaurants - bear in mind though that most independent stuff shuts between 2 - 5pm, and most Barcelona people eat at about 9pm! We ate earlier some days though and it wasn't a problem. It was more pricier on those streets as its near the tourist attraction - the area La Riberia is cheaper and nicer. For our budget, this hotel was great and met all of our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “:-( THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN - IN MY LIFE PERIOD :-(”
Reviews.Author: Satisfactionscript
Reviews.Content: I'll stick to the facts. We arrived to the hotel on Wed 24th - we were put on the seventh floor facing the back in room 704 - we went into the room and closed the door - the handle came off in our hands. We phoned the receptionist, Marco and explained the situation - he didn't seem very interested in coming to help us and said he would 'try' to phone the maintenance man. We eventually got ourselves out of the room. Then he put us on the third floor in room 311. The air conditioning unit started leaking (it's located just outside the bathroom) into our suitcase - saturating our clothes - while we were sleeping. We were understandably angry so we rang the receptionist (this time Tania) and she said 'this was normal' - I love her explanations. I tried to explain to her having a huge pool of water in the middle of your room (a tiny room at that) is not 'normal'. So then we were moved to room 204. Here the toilet cistern kept flooding so everytime you went to use the toilet your trouser legs ended up saturated. We were so sick of changing rooms and wasting so much time (we kept being told we would just have to pack our bags and leave our bags in the reception which was not ideal) - every day we were wasting about 1-2 hours changing rooms. Complete nightmare. The breakfast was also very very basic (baked beans, cold tortilla, cheap yoghurts) the one highlight of the breakfast was the melon (very fresh). The biggest problem though for me was the wifi or rather the lack of it (they gave various excuses such as someone used a MAC and the wifi stopped working, Steve Jobs would be happy, so the only solution was to sit in the lobby everytime I needed the internet which was highly frustrating), we were warned after checking-in by Marco that the internet would not be working at all from Thursday 12pm to Friday 12pm so in other words for an entire 24 hour period. This turned into a comedy, I asked his colleague Tania to direct me to the closest wifi cafe - she sent me out three times to three different cafes, it turned out the one she was trying to send me to actually was an internet cafe but CLOSED TWO YEARS PREVIOUSLY, so I asked Tania (extremely unhelpful person) how long she had been working in the hotel for - we chose the hotel based on it's location (it was extremely expensive we paid 125Euros for what we thought was a double room for two people - when we got there Marco charged us a 25 Euro supplement as we'd apparently booked a double room for one person - so a complete and total rip off for this price) - they also try to OVERSELL you tickets - their 'reduced price' ticket for the Barcelona Bus Tour cost me 25 Euros (on the bus it cost 23 Euros). In short, I've stayed in a lot of hotels (I'm currently writing this review from a very nice Holiday Inn in Frankfurt) in my business life but this is undoubtedly the worst - PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR and even if it's the last hotel available in Barcelona - DO NOT TAKE IT, STAY WELL AWAY - these people think that the BBC comedy programme Fawlty Towers - is a business plan that they should try to aspire to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Value!”
Reviews.Author: Nicky4477
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the this hotel in early June. The hotel is clean and simple. It includes a good breakfast. The service is good. The location is great. Very close to the Sagrada Cathedral and to many restaurants. Also near the Sagrada Cathedral, you can easily take the double decker city tour buses. You can purchase the tickets in the hotel. You can purchase 1 or 2 day passes and can hop and off the bus throughout the city. This is a great way to see all of the city. Barcelona is quite large. Beautiful city! There is a store just across the street from the hotel to purchase snacks and water and other drinks. You can also purchase bottles of wine in the store. Of course, one of the best parts of this hotel is the roof top with a few chairs and tables. You have a view of the city and can see the Sagrada Cathedral. Hotel is great and Barcelona is city you must see!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT ENOUGH.....BUT NO SOUL”
Reviews.Author: SouthWalesGrumpy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Spain and Portugal and stayed 3 nights at the Sagrada Familia. In truth, it's what you would expect of a city centre hotel.......spotlessly clean, organised. Staff where very helpful (not so usual in cities!) and the location, two streets north of the Cathedral was surprisingly quiet. 100 yards from the lovely restaurants and bars close to the cathedral. Rooftop terrace was a nice bonus as the temperatures soared. All pleasant enough for E70 per night and yes, I would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, I'll recommend it”
Reviews.Author: mthmb
Reviews.Content: We staied at this hotel for 5 nights, in room 411. A nice room, not big but not small either. The bathroom was large enough and had all you need in it. The cleanliness varied from one day to another, depending of the person who was doing the cleaning. I have to mention that in all 5 days not once the space behind the bathroom door was vacumed. The hotel is at 5 minutes away from the subway (station Sagrada Familia wich is right in front of Sagrada Familia Temple), and 2 minutes away from OpenCor, a shop well supplied, opened 'till 2AM (no alchool after 10PM). We paid 288 Euros for 5 nigths (25.03-30.03) , breackfast not included. Very good price/quality ratio. We would stay at this hotel again if we will visit Barcelona once more.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, well placed, clean”
Reviews.Author: SaBi_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I enjoyed our stay here. The reception staff were helpful with email queries before we arrived (having been attacked - luckily in vain - by two pickpockets on the train from the airport - NB keep valuables inside bag INSIDE coat; it happens very fast). In response to advance query hotel provided kettle/teabags in the room, hope this becomes the norm. Room was spacious, impeccably cleaned daily, and we were lucky to be given a room with a balcony. Two blocks from the amazing Sagrada Familia temple (go very early to reduce queue time) and the metro, and plenty of choice of local restaurants; inclusive menus good value on weekdays. Book breakfast in hotel for min. 3 nights on arrival (and make sure booking is logged) to get reduction from 11 to 8 Euros, it's a plentiful buffet to set you up. We bought 5 day travel tickets at the airport, which go on everything except the tourist bus, and also covered the funicular up the Montjuic 'mountain', but not the cable car to the castle which is worth the extra. City buses are fine but even the locals don't seem to know which one goes where (take 92 2 blocks northwards for entrance to Park Guell). Look for lifts on most metro stations if carrying luggage.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: stellavillarosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near La Sagrada Familia and from there you can easily navigate Barcelona through the Metro . The room is the right size for the proce that we pay for ..the hotel is clean, the girl in the reception was very helpful when we asked on how to go around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent price, small & clean”
Reviews.Author: Tequila007
Reviews.Content: Location is great, really walking distance to Sagrada Familia, looks like typical small business hotel, not really charming, cozy or personal but very correct. Service good & quick, solid breakfast, rooms rather smaller, very basic but clean. We paid around 80 EUR per night, so excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “great deal and good location”
Reviews.Author: CecileHo
Reviews.Content: it's just two blocks away from Sagrada Familia and metro. The hotel is in a quiet location and the staff speaks english. The room is clean with contemporary style. It's a great deal for such a convenient location. definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: AndyT1975
Reviews.Content: A small but clean room, with an ever so comfortable bed and a small flat screen tv with Spanish and Catalan channels. A lovely big shower and a great location only 2 streets up from the Sagrada Familia make this a good choice if you are looking for a good quality 3 star hotel. Friendly, helpful and multi-lingual staff added to the pleasure of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcrmmay
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located. Staff very efficient. The room was big enough for three adults. Three blocks from Sagrada Familia Church and subway. Curtains should be cleaned or renewed. They give a dirty feel to the room. Besides that would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ... Pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Ready4Go
Reviews.Content: The hotel is blocks from the Metro which is very helpful in navigating the city. The staff was terrific. They help us book tours and always greeted us with a smile no matter the time of day. The room was spacious considering that it is europe - large barthroom, but no place to put soap in shower. The hotel is also in a good neighborhood. Very easy to catch a taxi if heading out late at night to clubs or other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, 'boutique' hotel meaning run-down building made trendy”
Reviews.Author: Skooter22
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel, which I've talked about in another review. In my experience this means either a previous flop house hotel or an old building that's been renovated to look trendy. The scars remain however, and old walls, dirty nooks and crannies, and a general feeling of it being a run-down old building remain but the rooms have original big bathtubs and great water pressure. We got there after driving into Barcelona in the middle of the night, exhausted, with no reservation. Even though at 2:30am we obviously had no other place to stay when asking for the rate, the night person was very nice and gave us a discount making this very reasonable (about 75 euros). We ended up staying three nights though we changed rooms to have a regular double bed instead of two singles pushed together. The building has a strange lay-out with odd elevators but that's the boutique part I suppose. We didn't eat breakfast here, but free internet had good, strong connection. It's right up the street from Gaudi's famous church so you can hop on the red tourist bus a block from the hotel. The a/c was strong and we got a good sleep here. Also, there's a minibar frig with replaceable items from the little market just across the street. There's an Arabic bakery and a typical coffee bar for locals--NOT trendy--with great cafe con leche just next door. Good English skills with front desk staff. Parking is 25 euros per night, one block away. The rooms could've used a paint job but our stay was pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “ok, very nice hotel, staff, not so great... boo!”
Reviews.Author: ziggyaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, the breakfast was the best, great selection. The area was also ok, in walking distance to many places. The staff was not that great, our A/C didn't work throughout our entire stay and they refused to move us or even make any reasonable discount. They discounted the price of one rollaway bed for one day, we were there for four days with no A/C!... I would not recommend only because I still believe goo customer service should be the number one priority to any business. The rate we got wasn't that cheap either!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: xoxobrazil
Reviews.Content: The rooms were new, nice bathroom. The bad is not a double bed, a littel bit noisy. But the staff is fine and also the price. good

Reviews.Title: “Not great. . . better hotels available for less”
Reviews.Author: stevielatphoto
Reviews.Content: Went to the Spanish Grand prix and thought the trip advisor ratings were good. Hotel looks great from the outside and the reception area was clean and welcoming. But there, things went downhill. We had booked a double room, but none were available, (we got over that ), settled for a twin. Sent us to a room on the 6th floor, where we were greeted by a man sleeping on his bed !!!!. We were then given another room, which was at back of hotel, immediately we found it really noisy. Fixtures in the room were broken, cheap plastic laminate flooring, grubby walls, chipped furniture, leaking shower unit, broken bathroom lights ( at this stage, I would like to point out I don't mind all of this, but when you pay £120 a night you expect more). On day 2, no towels, or toilet roll left in room, had to go to reception and get it ourselves. Day 3, room wasn't even cleaned, ( we had taken do not disturb sign off door, but when we returned a new one had been put back on). Wifi was really poor, and inconsistent. Regarding location, it was close to a metro station, but there is a metro station every couple of blocks in Barcelona. Found the area dirty and lacking atmosphere. Thankfully, we didn't have to spend too much time in the hotel. Grand prix was great and worth the visit, but if i we HAD to stay at this hotel again, I would pay no more than £50 a night, but on 2nd thoughts, I don't think we would stay here again, even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place, and location!”
Reviews.Author: zsalya10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of March. The room was nice and clean and modern. It was in a fine location and wasn't too far from the metro. Sagrada Familia is in two minutes, and you can see it every day. :o) Staff were polite and helpful. We had breakfast in the price, and it was super to start the day with delicious food. We would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: miniadventurer99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the sagrada familia while in Barcelona on a mini break and was pleasantly surprised having booked it as part of a package deal in a travel agents therefore hadn't checked it on trip advisor first as i usually would. The check in was speedy however not much information was offered about the hotel or the surrounding area. The room was spacious and very clean with a tv, mini fridge, comfortable bed an electronic safe which was handy for keeping our passports and money that we didn't want to take out with us.The view from the window wasn't particularly scenic but that didnt really bother us as its not what i expect from a city break. When leaving that night we asked at the reception to direct us to somewhere nearby to eat as we had arrived late and didn't want to venture too far, the directions the receptionist gave us were quite vague to the point where we ended up lost for around 30mins however taxis are plentiful at all times of day. We didn't feel comfortable walking form the centre back to the hotel as the streets are quite maze like but the taxis were cheap enough that we just used them when ever we needed to. Breakfast was lovely, it was completely self service but they had everything you needed laid out. All continental as you normally find in Europe but delicious. On leaving we found out that there was a roof terrace which we definitely would have availed of had we known as smokers, but there is a self contained courtyard downstairs (not sure if thats still there) for smokers which was more than adequate however im sure the views from the roof would have been lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base in the city”
Reviews.Author: TeamAmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sagrada Familia for 5 nights and thought it was a great value hotel. the reception staff weren't the friendliest we've ever encountered, but they were polite and helpful, arranging a taxi for us on our last morning and advising us of local amenities. The lobby, lift, stairs and corridors were all spotless, as was our room. In fact the only negative point we had with the room was that there were scuff marks along one wall (obviously from where suitcases had scuffed the paintwork) which could easily have been touched up. Our room was large and airy, with a big clothes storage space, a long desk, tv & easy chair and a mini fridge. The bathroom was a nice size, too, with a really good walk-in shower. One of the best things about the suite was that it had a brilliant air-conditioning system which meant getting a good night sleep was easy, as was cooling down after a long day out in the sun. The hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood, but only a short walk from small cafes and bars (none of which we were that taken by, it has to be said) and about 5 minutes away from the Sagrada Familia itself. Despite it's proximity to this ever-popular attraction there was no disruption in or around the hotel. The metro station is also only a 5 minute walk away, making it easy to go into Barcelona centre and back to the hotel. We would definitely recommend the hotel to others visiting the city who want a clean, cool, spacious room to retire to after a long day in the sun (and evening in a bar!). And a little tip - the local store directly opposite the hotel main entrance is worth a visit for extremely good but cheap Cava, beers and crisps for late-night enjoyment!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Perfectly fine!”
Reviews.Author: Napen01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of May. The room was nice and clean and modern. It got cleaned daily and we had no complaints! It was in a fine location and wasn't too far from the metro. Staff were polite and helpful. Able to sit up on the roof if have a moment and relax, which was nice. Only downside was that we were given an inside facing window which had no sunlight at all, therefore you didn't know if it was light or dark outside! And didnt really let any fresh air in. Still didn't spoil anything though and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Cold, buisness hotel 2star only”
Reviews.Author: BOB204
Reviews.Content: Went for my birthday with friends on the 6th December for 3 nights. Found the hotel very buisness like, cold and not very festive, staff nice but disinterested in the cold lobby. Avoid the extra for breakfast you'll be better of eatting in one of the many nice cafe's in the area. The room's are small no tea or coffee and the inner rooms of the hotel are like a sweat box's even in the winter our aircon was broken and they had no spare twin room's to move to. The location was ok for some sights but you would be better down town near the la rabblas and harbour areas were all the life is to get there was a 25 minute walk or expensive taxi's. Bad location for anybody but good walkers.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the x12 rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: bilbospain
Reviews.Content: The x12 rooms are facing the inner courtyard; they are pillbox-sized, my one had a smuggy hodeur and the walls were dirty. There is no minibar inside, the wlan coverage is quasi nonexistent and the room has a connecting door to the next one - you can enjoy every move of your unkown neighbours. This room has nothing in common with the pictures on the hotels website! At least it was clean. The breakfast is hostel-style, not worth 13 Euros; try the neighbourhood cafes, they are much better. The "must" for that hotel is a large room, not facing the inner courtyard, these are good for a three star . The location is ok; Sagrada Familia is crowded with tourists and crappy people sneaking around, but Avinguda Gaudi and the Hospital Sant Pau are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but experience depends on the room”
Reviews.Author: hlib
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 10 nights and could give ***+ to this hotel. Location: while you have to use metro a lot (going to city centre and to beaches), location is good. It is in the midst of inner city residential area that means no tourist crowds, no loud drunk companies, a lot of cafes, bars and supermarkets nearby. If you do not have breakfast included, I recommend La Boulangerie bakery on the next corner: perfect croissants and sandwiches, good coffee and service. However, if you plan to focus on beaches, it is not the best option (too far). Rooms: According to fire escape plan, rooms are very different. Mine had very small and dark living room (with very very small window to inner yard) but enormous bathroom. I think that the staff should not select this room for 10-night stay but I was traveling alone and decided not to complain. Also, as it was in corner of the floor, wi-fi coverage was awful. However, rooms with window to the street are large and nice. Room design is modern but cheapish (in line with room price). Generally hotel design is nice. Maintenance: Rooms are done every day and cleanliness standards are very high for this price range. However, some walls are dirty and need fresh paint and two light bulbs were not working on arrival. Service: Reception staff does not look friendly and client-focused, however all problems were solved easily. They do not bother about small details, e.g. you need sweater at +30 outside to use free internet terminal (there are two) as air conditioning is directed exactly on users' backs. Verdict: good value for EUR60-65 anyway (and could be very good if you get nice room) but do not expect miracles. In any case much better then anything on or near Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: joss7166
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, good sized rooms and very comfortable. Staff very nice and friendly except for the Lady - she was very unpleasant and really couldnt be bothered with guests arriving,asking advice or when leaving but apart from her it was perfect. The buffet breakfast was very expensive - but there are lots of lovely coffee shops nearby offering very nice breakfasts and were very reasonable priced. Very near the tube station and taxis stop outside the hotel doors and are very reasonably priced. If holidaying again in Barcelona I would definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very very pleasant stay! I really liked this place!”
Reviews.Author: tetatdo
Reviews.Content: After a long trip throughout Spain, I was delighted by the friendliness and service that Hotel Sagrada Familia gave me and my friends. From the moment we checked in, the hotel's staff was extremely friendly, and helpful. I had booked 2 rooms for 2 different couples and they made no fuss about each couple checking in on their own and paying their share. I had booked a single room for myself the second night I stayed there which meant I would have to switch rooms to a single after the first night. I was delighted when on the second night, the wonderful woman at the front desk phoned me and told me I could just stay in the double room I was in. Overall the rooms are pretty adequate. I would say this hotel was new in the 90's, it has a very modern feel to it, but some of the things in the room are a bit faded. But for 60 euros a night on avg, you're getting a decent sized air conditioned room, a very nice bathroom (looks very modern) and a hotel that is literally 2 blocks from Sagrada Familia, Catalonia Plaza, minutes from Playa Olimpica and only a few subway stops away from Parc Guell. I found it very very easy to get around to around, and the hotel staff were very helpful whether I needed a taxi or to find out how to get around the city. Breakfast is served every morning and is located at the small dining room type area in the back. It is 4 Euros. I personally didnt have time to have breakfast but I thought that is a pretty good deal, all things considered. The best part is the free wifi they provide in-room! I was able to get the password from the staff and jump on with no trouble at all. Skype and T-mobile UMA work perfectly from their network. Even the mini bar in the room was reasonably priced. Everything in the mini-bar was 2 euros! Overall, this is a very modern looking hotel with decent accomodations. The rooms were clean (maybe a little over used) but for the value, it cant be beat!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I booked this room as a triplet, it is hard to find a hotel that would accommodate three. We were expecting a teeny tiny room but were pleasantly surprised that although it was small, there was room to maneuver around and that the bathroom was roomy as well. The beds were hard ( as we expected), but the room was clean, linens fresh and the bathroom clean and stocked with amenities. We had to ask housekeeping for the amenities (towels etc...) for the third person, but they complied right away. We booked the room with breakfast and again we were not disappointed. The fruits were fresh, as well as all breads and pastries. It was a good spread all in all, no hot food station, though, like omelettes etc.. The staff was solicitous and helpful, always greeted us when we walked in, as if we were coming home, not into a hotel. Best of all the location was convenient , just 3 blocks from the Sagrada Familia stop on the metro. Just beware of kids and sketchy people offering to take your photos with your camera, and of course beggars and gypsies around the Sagrada Familia. The hotel reception recommended cafes, bakeries and paella bistro located nearby and they were all excellent food and service as well. The one odd thing though, the hotel corridor walls were painted dark, really dark, but it was well lighted. They advertise it as view of the Sagrada Familia, but there is NO VIEW at all. When we checked in, I asked for the room with the view that they advertised, they brought us up to the top, but the curtains were light and thin, the sun heated the room so much, we decided to take the other room (no view at all) that they offered. It's okay there is so much to see in Barcelona, that view did not matter! There is free internet down by the reception area, and they have three computers ( a surprise for a small hotel). Checkout was efficient, no delay, and the taxi (their regular) was honest and pleasant. No hidden fees. All in all , a very pleasant stay. In fact, the year after (August 2008) I booked my two kids' (ages 18 and 20 ) visit to Barcelona in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SydTraveller09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in May 2009. The hotel is very very clean and the room was spacious. The bathroom is also a very generous size. The nearby metro has 2 lines which is helpful when getting around Barcelona. The hotel also has free internet in the lobby. It is fantastic for a 3 star hotel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Princess082
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Was in a good location right by the Sagrada Familia Church, the metro being easily accessible to get around. Was only 7 Euros in a taxi to get to Las Ramblas which we used at night as we didnt want to use the metro then. The room was clean and the hotel staff courteous and helpful. We didn't partake of the breakfast so for only 5 Euros we had a pastry and coffee at a lovely patisserie a few doors down. The only thing I would complain about is there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, only hotel I have ever stayed in without this facility. There was also free internet access which was good. We did the Turistica Bus tour (a must if you want to easily get around and see everything of interest). If you buy the ticket from reception it is only 19 Euros as opposed to 21 on the bus itself. You give reception 4 Euros (must be their commission) and pay the additional 15 Euros when you get on the bus. There are three routes in total and you can hop on or off at any place you wish as many times as you like during the day. A great way to see Barcelona and all this wonderful city has to offer. All in all we had a wonderful time and will definitely be returning !

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but bring the ice cubes”
Reviews.Author: macks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty cheap - about €60 per night, which in Barcelona seemed to be a bargain; so my expectations were relatively low when we arrived. The location is perfect - 2 minutes from the Sagrada Familia and the associated metro, and surrounded by some reasonable cafes and a couple of restaurants. Couple of small supermarkets nearby which stocked reasonable ranges of stuff. The room was a reasonable size, decent condition and generally alright. The minibar was reasonably priced (€2 for a bottle of water) but we couldn't find the bottle opener for the capped bottles, and a couple of the items were past their best before dates. More frustratingly, the air conditioning wasn't working in April, so the room we were in was very hot (the thermometer on a dodgy fridge magnet said 28C). The window opened onto the internal covered courtyard so even with the window wide open the room didn't cool down much. Secondly the beds were very hard - ok if you sleep on your back but sleeping on my side was a bit of a torture. All in - not a bad hotel, and I'd recommend to people having warned them of the quirks!

Reviews.Title: “Like the location...”
Reviews.Author: 3rdWorldFan
Reviews.Content: This was my first european trip so I was initially a little shocked by the small room. However the room was very clean, and the amenities were quite nice. The view from my room was a bit unusual as I had a birdseye view of rooftop homes. The front desk was relatively helpful, one drawback was the fact that the hotel doors would lock after 10pm so i would have to wait to get buzzed in, in order to get to my room. And if there was no one at the front desk at the time I was SOL. The location was great. The Sagrada Familia Church is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. There's also a metro stop about the same distance. Internet access fairly limited as there is only one computer accesible to all the hotel guests, so I'd find myself waiting for the computer when ever I needed its use. The breakfast buffet was decent, although at one point the front desk told me that I couldnt take the food from the breakfast area up to my room. Overall a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: karma_21uk
Reviews.Content: I definitely would not recommend this hotel for the following reasons a) Upon arrival at the hotel we were ignored by the receptionist who was taking a personal phone call, he checked us in whilst all the time chatting away on his mobile. He did not greet us, tell us what room we were in or how to find it. Thankfully, we never encountered him again and the other receptionists were much more helpful b) Although the room was a good size, clean yet basic it was a connecting room. The rooms had wooden floor boards so we could hear people in the next room walking around and talking...every word! We hardly slept our entire stay because of the noisy couple next door. Need I say more! c) The location of the hotel, although obviously close to the Sagrada Familia, is quite far from the main hub of the city. Apart from the hotel and the lack of sleep, the holiday was fantastic and Barcelona is a wonderful city...I would recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A few rooms stiflingly hot when they shut down the aircon in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: TimDawn
Reviews.Content: Staff seemed quite friendly and maintained their cool even after midnight when we complained that we couldn't keep ours. There is air conditioning in the rooms,It was explained that by November it is switched off. The hotel website does not mention this. Our room faced ino the building and was stiflingly hot even with the window wide open and the curtains back, yet the daytime temperature had been only 18 Celsius. We got very little sleep. We got a free breakfast and were moved to a much more pleasant room for the remaining three nights where aircon was not needed at all because the windows opened to outside. The hotel was found to be clean and well maintained. We had booked a double room on Lastminute.com Apparently there is only one double on each floor, making only about six out of 84 rooms a double. Our first night was in a twin room, then we got a double. There is no way I could get my standard size laptop into the safe (as stated on the hotel's website), apart from the screen it does not fold up any more! The breakfast, at 11 Euros seems expensive, but is good value if you are hungry because you can eat as much as you want. There are no tea and coffee making facilities available apart from in the air-conditioned dining room at breakfast time, so pack a travel kettle. The minibar has some space for cooling your own food and drink. There is quite a good 'library' with information and two PCs. The neutral rating takes into account our problems on the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: trisha13
Reviews.Content: We were finding accommodation in Barcelona quite expensive then came across this hotel after almost giving up - not cheap but affordable. The reception was clean and modern and check in was quick and easy. The room, although clean, was a little neglected as there were scuff marks all around the walls but other than that the room was great. There is a lovely rooftop terrace from where you can see the spires of the cathedral - unfortunately we didn't find this until our last night so didn't actually get to use it! Although the hotel has no bar or restaurant facility other than offering a buffet breakfast, the hotel is surrounded by lovely little food outlets and bars. We didn't go for the breakfast at 11 euros as it was much cheaper to eat better outside of the hotel. The nearest metro station is only a 5-10 minute walk away as is the Sagrada Familia cathedral. The staff seemed efficient and knowledgeable (not overly friendly but that's seems usual for Spanish hotels). If I had to think of anything negative it would be that there was no information about the hotel or the area in the room (maybe we would have found the rooftop terrace if there had been) and the lifts were incredibly slow. Overall though a great hotel and great location and we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zmeczonka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon and we loved it. It is modern, clean and nicely designed. Rooms are small, but have everything you need. Location is also very good - close to subway and SF cathedral. I would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Voyager2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May 2008 on business. The hotel itself is clean and modern and the check in area is very smart. I started off in room 504 but when I went in, only 1 light actually had a bulb in and the room door wouldn't lock. I went straight back down to the reception and a very helpful man grabbed some light bulbs and a wrench and followed me up to see what we could do. After fixing the lights, he realised that he wasn't going to be able to fix the lock but did point out that no-one could really enter without a keycard. However, I did want a room that locked from the inside so he helped me move my cases up to room 708. I did have to take my towels and pillows from the previous room which did look a bit odd, but we laughed about it in the elevator. He was very apologetic. Both rooms were clean and modern and had air-con. The street is very safe, about a 5 minute walk from the metro. I had a twin room with both beds pushed together. The bathroom had a lovely walk in shower which was bliss. The floors however are wooden, so you can hear people moving about in other rooms. The staff were very nice to me, and booked me taxis for my meetings and were generally nice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MicheleCdn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Sagrada Familia hotel. Our room was clean, staff were friendly, good shower, no problems. We did not try the breakfast buffet feeling it was too expensive at €11 per person. Safe, residential neighborhood, 5 min from Sagrada Familia church and metro stop. Many small grocery stores around and a good nonsmoking bakery/cafe 2 doors down. If you feel like Chinese food, try Casa Fong on Carrer de Sardenya walking towards the metro station. Short walk from hotel for great food, service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: silviaspt
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel with modern furniture, and very close to Sagrada Família and metro. There are a lot of restaurants and supermarkets around the hotel. I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: Tekkamuna
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as part of a package offer on easyjet. the hotel is easy to find as it's only about 10 mins walk fr the Metro.When we got to the hotel, the front desk people were not busy at all but it took about 3 minutes for them to finish shuffling papers and looking at which of them two would attend to us. The lady finally gave it and asked me (in spanish) some question to which I replied (in english) that I didn't speak spanish. I gave her the hotel voucher and she asked for my passport as well.She did things very roughly, banging the photocopier cover, shoving her chair aside to make room for her to move about and then dropping her pen and saying something (in spanish) under her breath which thank God I didn;t understand. She shoved me the hotel key and said thats your card. and then she sat down. Im like? errrr- do we have a double bed as requested via booking three weeks ago? she said NO. I said any chance? she said NO. err how about the breakfast we paid for? where is the breakfast room and what time? she said you come down here, 8am. Im like okaay..she must have a bad hair day. when we got up the lift which btw gives you a little jump when it stops, we got to our room which was terribly warm. the website says all rooms are air conditioned but it isn't. i rang reception and the guy said, Madam, in winter what we have is a heater and in the summer if you feel hot, open the window. Okaaay...Thanks a lot. the bathroom had a little dead cockroach, the bedroom flooring was missing two tiles so you can see the foam underneath the flooring and the towels are dirty. Too bad for this place which has as one of its great points, location proximity to Sagrada. I wouldn't stay here again unless all you wanted to see was the Sagrada.

Reviews.Title: “Good price hotel”
Reviews.Author: passionandlove
Reviews.Content: I suggested this hotel to my parents who were here to visit me for the second time, so they had lived the overcrowded streets and hotels scenario and didn't want to repeat it, and its the least to say that they were very happy with the location, since its in the heart of Barcelona, but still calm and safe enough to live the real Barcelona and mingle with the locals. Very close is the Sagrada Familia and its Avenida Gaudi, which is a lovely street that starts with terraces with a impressive view of the Sagrada Familia and ends with a equally impressive view of The Hospital Sant Pau, a hidden spot of Barcelona which is worth while walking the avenida gaudi just to discover it. For lunch or dinner (since they light up the church at night) its just great to seat at one of the tables of the avenida gaudi restaurant terraces, and then after a couple of glasses of wine, head towards el Barrio de Gracia to find the nontouristy bars or just go back to your room, because it is all walking distance and if going far, the metro is right there as well. I've been in Barcelona for a year now and I personally love the area, but there aren't a lot of hotels in this neighborhood to choose from. My parents were satisfied with my choice and we marked this hotel as a favorite and they would definitely repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LeedsLassLeeds_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Sagrada Familia at the end of November. The hotel was very clean and our room on floor 5 was a reasonable size with a huge walk in shower. The room had the benefit of a large balcony from which we could see the spires of Sagrada Familia. The buffet breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice of cheeses, meats, pastries, bread and fruit and a selection of teas, coffee, juices and water. The staff were very helpful and provided a map of Barcelona. The instructions to find the hotel on their website is informative and accurate and we had no trouble finding it from the Metro station in the dark. We used the Metro extensively buying a 10 ticket pack. An excellent hotel to which I'd be glad to return and I'd recommend it to anyone. I booked it on Yeego and paid 75 Euros per night for both of us including buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: caseypaul
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel on exiting Sagrada Familia metro was a bit of a challenge using the hotels directions. Once located, check-in was pleasant and efficient. Hotel is 3 mins from Sagrada Familia. I has faxed the hotel a couple of days ahead of time asking for a quiet room well away from the lifts. They had received my request and allocated me a room accordingly. My rear facing room on floor 4 was modern, very clean and wholly functional. A double bed would have been more comfortable than the two small singles pushed together but hey! Bathroom was roomy with a nice big walk-in shower. Mini-bar was reasonably priced. Only down side was finding a pair of (clean, I think) womens panties and a bandana on top of the spare pillow in the closet - some might find this an added extra but I didn't!!! I didn't bother with the buffet breakfast but instead took breakfast at the very pleasant cafe two door away. Great coffee, pastries and sandwiches with cheery service all for €5. For the €70 I paid for 1 night, this place was just fine. Would be happy to return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location shame about the standard of accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Warders
Reviews.Content: While the room was adequate it was badly in need of re-decoration as is the whole hotel. The window would not close due to a broken catch. Poor soundproofing and breakfast, while buffet advertised, no toaster available. Staff were pleasant but building needs attention.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sagrada Familia
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Corsega 541, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
